lead_paragraph: Police officers in the borough will no longer arrest most people who commit minor offenses under a policy shift that officials hope will help to reduce a backlog of cases.

headline.print_headline: Summonses, Not Arrests, for Small Crimes in Manhattan
headline.main: Summonses, Not Arrests, for Small Crimes in Manhattan

snippet: Police officers in the borough will no longer arrest most people who commit minor offenses under a policy shift that officials hope will help to reduce a backlog of cases.
abstract: New York City police will issue summonses instead of arresting people for small infractions like drinking alcohol in public or taking up two seats on the subway; officials believe policy change will lead to 10,000 fewer cases being prosecuted, freeing up police and prosecutors to focus on more serious crimes.
